channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytiping again, 12th October
item.description:
Same place as every week, domestic rubbish dumped on the side of the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 259, Chipperfield Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: These bushes need cutting right back immediately!, 12th October
item.description:
I have been to Bexley council, bounced to TFL and now back to the council to get these bushes cut right back that are protruding into the road making the road even more narrow and dangerous! They are also really overhanging across into the road so Lorrie’s are snapping branches that are then falling into the road. Something must be done about this asap as it’s becoming an absolute joke how Bexley council fob off people reporting this so they don’t have to do it. Also, where are your street inspectors????

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Mead, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: After recent accident with E-bike Reported via mobile anonymously at 12:09, Thursday 11 September 2025 Sent to Hackney Council less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 8151782. After the recent accident of a 6yesr old girl being hit by an E-bike I find it even more important to adress the issue of the road between park and playground . There need to be speed bumps and some sort of restriction so bikes do not speed past playgroun, 12th October
item.description:
Lime bikes causing injury to small children playing in the London borough of Hackney. These bikes are very dangerous causing severe injuries to innocent people.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hillman Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hazelmere between glengall and priory park road, 12th October
item.description:
The stretch of the street (which would be a lovely place for kids to play) became a dumping ground and drug abuse spot. We need this to be fixed urgently. It’s dark, dangerous and dirty. Yesterday there was a fight which led someone bleeding. We called the police.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hazelmere Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Fire Hazard / Litter Issue, 12th October
item.description:
The budlia trees that are growing as weeds out of this council building are not only a huge fire hazard to the entire row of houses (Grade II listed Georgian Buildings) but they also encourage people to throw rubbish down into them.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet
